data: Cheshire | Ouselcroft | Daresbury | French window | Lebanon
drawing-room | Ouselcroft | Daresbury | French window | lawn

One summer evening, Mildred Calverley, accounted the prettiest girl in Cheshire, who had been seated in the drawing-room of her fatherâ€™s house, Ouselcroft, near Daresbury, vainly trying to read, passed out from the open French window, and made her way towards two magnificent cedars of Lebanon, at the farther end of the lawn.
